summary: This document is an email chain from November 2020 regarding the production of documents in the US v. Epstein case. It discusses the status of copying productions to hard drives, stamping documents, loading data into a database, and shipping arrangements. The correspondence involves coordination between legal teams and vendors handling evidence.

events.title: Completion of document productions
events.description: Email states that all productions are complete except for recently loaded USAO-SDFL files/hard copy scan documents, and hard drives with productions 15 & 16 are ready for shipment.

events.title: Progress update on document stamping and loading
events.description: Vendor finished stamping part 5 of production, exported parts 1-3 from Relativity, started stamping part 6, and loaded USAO-SDFL files into another Epstein database.

events.title: Discussion of extension request
events.description: Email mentions planning to ask Judge Nathan for an extension for document production, but notes progress in stamping part 4.

keyFacts: The email chain documents the logistical process of preparing and producing evidence (productions 15 & 16) in the US v. Epstein case in November 2020.
A vendor was used to stamp documents and export them from Relativity software, with the production broken into seven parts.
Data from USAO-SDFL (U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida) files was loaded into an Epstein database.
There was consideration of requesting an extension from Judge Nathan, but progress suggested it might be ready before the discussed November 19th date.
Hard drives containing the productions were prepared for shipment via FedEx, with passwords provided for access.
